block.p: Coach Bob Hurley, who has guided St. Anthony's of Jersey City to 19 New Jersey state basketball championships, was named a winner of the Frank McGuire Award yesterday along with four other metropolitan area high school coaches.

Also named were: Vince O'Connor of St. Francis Prep in Queens, football; Maria Nolan of Secaucus (N.J.) High School, volleyball; and two Long Island coaches, Ted Adams of Hempstead, basketball, and Joe Cuozzo of Ward Melville in East Setauket, lacrosse.

Coach Bob Hurley, who has guided St. Anthony's of Jersey City to 19 New Jersey state basketball championships, was named a winner of the Frank McGuire Award yesterday along with four other metropolitan area high school coaches.

Also named were: Vince O'Connor of St. Francis Prep in Queens, football; Maria Nolan of Secaucus (N.J.) High School, volleyball; and two Long Island coaches, Ted Adams of Hempstead, basketball, and Joe Cuozzo of Ward Melville in East Setauket, lacrosse.
The McGuire awards are named in memory of the three-time basketball coach of the year at three different colleges: St. John's, North Carolina and South Carolina.
This year's five winners, who were chosen for their positive influence on young athletes, will be honored Nov. 2 at the second annual Frank McGuire Foundation dinner at the New York Athletic Club.
